clinical_study.brief_title: Combination Alexandrite Laser and Topical Therapy vs Topical Therapy Alone for Treatment of Melasma
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Split-Face, Double-Blind Clinical Pilot Study of Combination Picosecond Alexandrite Laser and Non-Hydroquinone Topical Therapy Versus Topical Therapy Alone for the Treatment of Facial Melasma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of a combination of non-hydroquinone topical therapy and a 755nm Alexandrite compared to topical therapy alone for the treatment of facial melasma.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 3 months post last treatment
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the efficacy of a combination of non-hydroquinone topical therapy and a 755-nm alexandrite laser compared to topical therapy alone in the treatment of melasma .

arm_group.description: 755nm Alexandrite laser for the treatment of melasma
